intro: Silene hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Silene hirsuta is a perennial species that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with well-drained soil.
